page.title: 05SHEFFORD ANNUAL FAIR
page.content: In 1312 a Royal Charter granted to Shefford the right to hold an annual fair.This was held at Michaelmas each year but in recent years has been held as a street fair on the eleventh of October. At the fair are lots of rides.There is a waltzer which is a round board with lots of round seats on it.When it goes round the seats twirl around as well.There is a mini wheel and a ride called a Mexican hat which goes round with one side up and one side down. There are lots of stalls that sell candy floss,pop-corn,balloons and sweets.There are stalls to play games on such as darts and throwing the hoops. If the fair does not come one year it cannot come again.
